collection.description: Expression property. Collection name. Can be of the form `collection.subcollection.value` to access sub collections

with_type.description: If `True`, includes the signal type in the document.

nio/MongoDB.Description: Stores input signals in a mongo database. One document will be inserted into the database for each input signal.
nio/MongoDB.Input: One document will be inserted into the database for each input signal.

collection.description: String property. Collection name. Can be of the form `collection.subcollection.value` to access sub collections

with_type.description: If `True`, includes the signal type in the document.

nio/MongoBulkInsert.Description: Exactly the same as MongoDB, except it stores data much faster. This is because it's `collection` property is a String property, not an Expression property. This speeds things up, as it doesn't have to evaluate it for every insert.
nio/MongoBulkInsert.Input: One document will be inserted into the database for each input signal.
